name: Creamy Chicken Alfredo Linguine with Roasted Broccoli
description: Family-friendly Alfredo-style chicken pasta with a quick roasted broccoli side. Mild, comforting, and ready in about 25 minutes.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the pasta.
Cut chicken thigh fillets into 2–3 cm pieces; pat dry.
cook_steps: Toss broccoli with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and pepper on a baking tray; roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Add linguine to boiling water; cook until al dente (pack time), reserving 1 cup pasta water. Drain.
Meanwhile, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper; cook 5–6 minutes, stirring, until cooked through and lightly browned.
Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in white sauce and cream; simmer 2–3 minutes, loosening with splashes of reserved pasta water as needed to make a silky sauce.
Add drained linguine to the skillet; toss with parmesan cheese until coated and creamy. Adjust salt and pepper to taste; add more pasta water if needed.
Squeeze a wedge of lemon over the pasta to brighten.
Serve pasta in bowls with roasted broccoli on the side. Offer extra lemon wedges at the table.
